singular.nino.help.body: Select a topic to learn about!
singular.nino.help.admin.body:
There are two types of Nino admins. Project-level admins have permissions on a per-project basis, while server admins have permissions for all projects, as well as some extras.
For more information, see the documentation for [Project Admins](https://github.com/9vult/nino/blob/master/docs/docs.md#project-admin-add) and [Server Admins](https://github.com/9vult/nino/blob/master/docs/docs.md#server-admin-add).
singular.nino.help.admin.title: Add administrators
singular.nino.help.airreminder.body: Set the series' AniList ID with `/project edit`. Then, use `/project airreminder enable` to enable notifications. Optionally, specify a role to be pinged.
singular.nino.help.airreminder.title: Be notified when episodes air
singular.nino.help.airtime.body: Set the series' AniList ID with `/project edit`.
singular.nino.help.airtime.title: See episode air times in embeds
singular.nino.help.blame.body: Anyone can use `/blame` to view the status of an episode and `/blameall` to view the status of all the episodes. `/blameall` also has additional filters and options.
singular.nino.help.blame.title: See who's stalling
singular.nino.help.conga.body:
You can set complicated mappings between tasks with `/conga add`. Many-Many relationships are allowed, so the completion of any combination of tasks can alert those assigned to any other combination of tasks. The possibilities are almost endless!
Use `/conga list` to keep track of your masterpiece.
singular.nino.help.conga.title: Ping people when tasks are complete
singular.nino.help.create.body:
Make sure Nino has all the permissions she needs. Then:
1. Run `/project create`. This command will initialize the project. Pick something short and memorable for the project nickname, you'll be using it a lot.
2. Add Key Staff to the project with `/keystaff add`. Key Staff are tasks that need to be done every episode.
3. Add any Additional Staff with `/additionalstaff add`. These are one-off tasks, like Song Styling.
4. (Optional) Add alias nicknames with `/project alias add` to make accessing the project easier.
singular.nino.help.create.title: Create a new project
singular.nino.help.customize.body: There are a few options for customizing how Nino behaves in your server. Please check the [Documentation](https://github.com/9vult/nino/blob/master/docs/docs.md#server) for specifics!
singular.nino.help.customize.title: Customize my server experience
singular.nino.help.done.body:
- Use `/done` to mark your task complete. The episode number is optional, even if you're an episode or several ahead of your team!

- If you're not actually doing the task, use `/skip`.
- If the task isn't actually done, use `/undone`.
- If you're doing a lot of episodes' worth, use `/bulk`.
singular.nino.help.done.title: Mark my task complete
singular.nino.help.help.body:
You're already looking at it, silly!

Additional help can be found in the [Documentation](https://github.com/9vult/nino/blob/master/docs/docs.md).
singular.nino.help.help.title: Get help
singular.nino.help.language.body: Use `/server setlocale` to set the preferred locale for your server. Nino will fallback to English (US) if there's no translation for your language available - If this is the case, consider [adding your language](https://github.com/9vult/nino/blob/master/docs/localization.md)!
singular.nino.help.language.title: Have Nino send embeds in my server's language
singular.nino.help.localize.body: Glad to hear it. [Detailed information](https://github.com/9vult/nino/blob/master/docs/localization.md) about localizing Nino can be found on GitHub.
singular.nino.help.localize.title: Localize Nino into my language
singular.nino.help.observer.body:
As long as Nino is in your server, you can observe projects that are either a) public or b) you are a part of.
Optionally, the project can be added to your server's `/blame` hotlist. You will need webhooks to subscribe to progress updates.
singular.nino.help.observer.title: Observe a project from my server
singular.nino.help.release.body:
Project owners and administrators can use `/release` to announce your new release.
You can release Episodes, Volumes, and Batches. For Episodes and Volumes, use the episode/volume number (`1`, `2`, etc). For Batches, use the range of episodes (`1-12`, etc).
Additionally, a role (or everyone) can be pinged.
singular.nino.help.release.title: Release/publish something
singular.nino.help.roster.body: Project members can use `/roster` to view assignees for an episode.
singular.nino.help.roster.title: See who's assigned to a task
singular.nino.help.staffswap.body:
For Key Staff positions:
- To swap someone in for a single episode, use `/keystaff pinchhitter set`.
- To swap someone in for all episodes, use `/keystaff swap`.

For Additionsl Staff positions, use `/additionalstaff swap`.
singular.nino.help.staffswap.title: Change who's doing what
singular.nino.help.transfer.body:
- Transferring to another owner: `/project transferownership`
- Transferring to another server: `/project transferserver` in the new server
- Transferring to another bot: `/project export`
singular.nino.help.transfer.title: Transfer my project to another person, server, or bot
singular.nino.help.weight.body:
You can use `/keystaff setweight` and `/additionalstaff setweight` to change the display order of tasks.
The default weight for Key Staff positions is the number they were added in, so the first task added has a weight of `1`. Additional Staff have a default weight of `1000000`, so setting any Key Staff's weight to `>1000000` will place it after Additional Staff positions (useful for Quality Check, for example).
singular.nino.help.weight.title: Re-order tasks
singular.nino.stats:
- Nino is currently managing **{{totalProjects|1}}** projects across **{{guilds|2}}** servers.
- Of **{{totalEpisodes|3}}** total episodes, **{{totalDonePercent|4}}%** are complete.

- There are **{{ongoingProjects|5}}** ongoing projects and **{{archivedProjects|6}}** archived projects.
- Of **{{ongoingEpisodes|7}}** episodes from ongoing projects, **{{ongoingDonePercent|8}}%** are complete.

- There are also **{{observerCount|9}}** observers observing **{{uniqueObservers|10}}** unique projects.
singular.progress.bulk:
I see you've been busy.
**{{taskName|1}}** for episodes {{start_episode|2}} through {{end_episode|3}} have been updated.
singular.progress.done: Nice job getting the **{{taskName|1}}** for episode {{episode|2}} done.
singular.progress.done.inTheDust:
Your team is still working on episode **{{currentEpisode|1}}**, but your task there is already done.
The next episode awaiting **{{taskName|2}}** is episode **{{nextEpisode|3}}**; did you want me to mark that one done instead?
singular.progress.done.inTheDust.dontDoIt: Okay; I won't touch anything, then.
singular.progress.done.inTheDust.question: What do you want me to do?
singular.progress.done.inTheDust.timeout: I waited a whole minute, and you didn't tell me what you wanted!
singular.progress.projectComplete:
**{{title|1}}** is complete.
Great job to everyone involved!
singular.progress.skipped:
**{{taskName|1}}** for episode {{episode|2}} has been skipped.
If you wish to do it for realsies, `/undone` it first.
singular.progress.undone: So the episode {{episode|1}} **{{taskName|2}}** wasn't done, after all.
singular.project.alias.addedAlias: I added `{{alias|1}}` as an alias for `{{project|2}}` for you.
singular.project.alias.removedAlias: I removed the alias `{{alias|1}}` from `{{project|2}}` for you.
singular.project.archive.question:
Are you sure you want to archive `{{project|1}}`?
This action is irreversible.
singular.project.conga.added: I added {{current|1}} → {{next|2}} to the Conga line for you.
singular.project.conga.empty: There is nobody doing the Conga for this project.
singular.project.conga.firstHelp: To have awaited tasks reminded at regular intervals, use `/project congareminder enable`.
singular.project.conga.removed: I removed {{current|1}} → {{next|2}} from the Conga line for you.
singular.project.congareminder.enabled: Enabled conga reminders for `{{project|1}}` with a period of {{hours|2}} hours.
singular.project.created:
I created project `{{nickname|1}}` for you. You may want to consider the following:
1. `/keystaff add` to add positions
2. `/keystaff setweight` to re-order positions
3. `/project edit`: `AniList` to set airing date/times, and `/airreminder enable` to get airing notifications.
singular.project.conga.union.added.current:
I added {{current|1}} → {{next|2}} to the Conga line for you.
There is now a union: {{union|3}} → {{next|4}}
singular.project.conga.union.added.next:
I added {{current|1}} → {{next|2}} to the Conga line for you.
There is now a union: {{current|3}} → {{union|4}}
singular.project.deleted: Cleaned out the **{{project|1}}** project for you. 残念。
singular.project.server.transferred: Moved `{{project|1}}` to this server. Good luck!
singular.server.admin.added: Added {{staff|1}} as an administrator for this server.
singular.server.admin.removed: I removed {{staff|1}}'s administrator privileges from this server.
